Clinical Requirements
Clinical for NURS 449 includes the completion of the following projects:

  1. Family assessment - Student will visit a family of their choice (not their immediate family) weekly for 5 weeks, assessing family and doing health teaching.
  2. Health teaching project - This can be a group project completed by 4-5 students if fellow students live in your area. A population within your community with a teaching need is selected. Students prepare and present a 30-minute health teaching program. A power point of the project and a professional brochure are to be submitted to the instructor.
  3. Community assessment - This can also be completed as a group if students live in the same area.
  4. Each student is required to visit and participate in three (3) community health clinics. When attending a clinic, be on time, plan spending the entire morning or afternoon. Students are to arrange all clinicals.

Clinical Option: Students have the option of completeing part of the course and/or clinical at a trans-cultural site if one is available. Further details will be provided to students choosing this option.

NURS 449 does not require a clinical placement request nor a preceptorship agreement because clinical hours are information gathering only.
